lines_and_colors: He preached about Breadth till we knew he was narrow
The Broad are too broad to define
And of Truth until it proclaimed him a Liar
The Truth never hoisted a sign -
Simplicity fled from his counterfeit presence
As Gold the Pyrites would shun
What confusion would cover the innocent Jesus
To meet so learned a man -
document.title: He preached about breadth till we knew he  was narrow
document.publication: The Poems of Emily Dickinson, Variorum Edition, Franklin, 1998
